Reviews.Content: good experience I booked it through Wotif.com, and after reading some mixed reviews about this hotel, i booked it anyway.I must say that my review will be a bit biased, because for 3 nights before that, i stayed at the Ramayana Resort in Kuta, and stayed in Vilarisi alone for the following 2 nights.The room was big for the price I paid, and it had a bath and a clean bathroom. The mattress and pillows couldn't compare to the fluffy ones i had at the other hotel, but it was fine for me to sleep in.Pros:- Friendly and helpful staff- great price- large room- cheap foodCons:- Location - it's located on the smaller streets, and gets a bit creepy if walking alone at night.- Mosquitos in the room, but they have repellents in the rooms.
Reviews.Author: nadio

Reviews.Content: Okay, But Not Great       Bed in Room 405
Reviews.Author: Bambi_Boulangerie

Reviews.Content: Not very bad but there are better choices... The room is a little too small, but room is quite clean. Another drawback is the mini pool. The swimming pool is really too small for an adult to swim.
Reviews.Author: tansui

Reviews.Content: Great, clean, budget hotel We stayed here both times we were in Legian, which is walkable to the bustle of Kuta. The rooms are very clean (every day we entered the floor was still wet from the cleaning) and there is air conditioning and a small pool for very cheap pricing. Breakfast is included - a minimal but adequate buffet with eggs done how you like them upon request. We liked this hotel because the rooms were quite large and it was accessible to the beach but away from the noise of cars going up and down the strip. It was also right beside the big shopping street that stretches all the way through Kuta. The only problem was that they're repairing the elevator, so that there is hammering all day right now for some reason. If you're in the room here during the day, though, there's a problem! The rooms facing the pool are a little quieter, but this is still not an issue. Support Bali if you're able through their political problems - it's a very worthwhile destination!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
